task_summary: Perceive the pot lid, approach and grasp the lid handle, lift to open the lid from the pot, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary manipulator must lift the metal lid from a pot positioned on a small black stand on a benchtop. The robot first detects and verifies the lid, opens its gripper, and approaches from above. After aligning to the lid handle, it closes the gripper to grasp, performs an opening motion by lifting the lid upward, and retreats to clear the pot rim. Visual confirmation and stable grasp are important due to reflections and clutter around the workspace.
preconditions: Robot base and arm within reachable workspace of the pot
Camera view of pot lid not fully occluded
Pot is static on the stand
stepwise_plan: Detect the pot lid and verify visibility.
Open the gripper and move above the lid.
Approach and align to the lid handle with tight tolerance.
Close gripper to grasp the handle.
Execute container-opening motion for a 'lid' by lifting upward.
Retreat to clear the pot rim.
success_criteria: Lid is visibly above the pot rim with clearance
No collision with pot, bench, or stand
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-detect or scan again before proceeding
If grasp slips, reopen gripper, realign, and regrasp
If collisions detected, retreat a short distance and re-approach with smaller tolerance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the lid is lifted and the arm has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: lift up a lid from the pot

node_specs.description: Detect the pot lid in the scene.
Verify the lid remains visible before moving.
Open gripper wide to prepare for grasp.
Move to a pre-grasp pose above the lid.
Approach and align to the lid handle precisely.
Close gripper to grasp the handle.
Lift/open the lid from the pot.
Retreat to clear the pot rim after lifting.

failure_modes: Lid not detected due to glare or occlusion
Misalignment with the handle causing failed grasp
Insufficient grip force leading to slip
Collision with pot rim during lift
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection or scan pattern, then retry approach
Back off slightly and lower tolerance before re-approach
Reopen gripper, regrasp with the same or higher force (20â†’30)
Abort lift and retreat if contact forces spike, then re-plan
assumptions: Frames appear to show a pot with a metal lid on a stand and a manipulator approaching from the side/above.
The lid has a graspable handle; lifting is the correct opening motion.
No explicit speed/force constraints in the instruction; default bins selected.

expected_success_criteria: Lid elevated above pot rim without dropping
No collisions and stable grasp during motion
